intro: Sphenogyne incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sphenogyne, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive, narrow shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Sphenogyne incisa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
